rules: Rule1: Either wolves were observed in the forest, or conservation in the forest was successful.
Rule2: If data on wolves were analyzed, then the movement of wolves was tracked.
Rule3: Provided that data on wolves were reviewed, the migration of deer was not disrupted.
Rule4: Under the condition that a report on wolves was submitted, either data on wolves were analyzed or data on wolves were reviewed.
Rule5: A report on wolves was submitted, or a report on wolves was presented.
Rule6: Whenever a report on wolves was presented, either data on wolves were analyzed or data on wolves were reviewed.
Rule7: Protection was implemented in the forest, or protection was enforced in the forest.
Rule8: Given that protection was enforced in the forest, the forest ecosystem was not damaged.
Rule9: Provided that monitoring of wolves was established, if protection was implemented in the forest, then the forest ecosystem was not damaged.
Rule10: If monitoring of wolves was continued, then monitoring of wolves was established.
Rule11: The impact of protection was evaluated, or the impact of protection was assessed.
Rule12: Given that the impact of protection was assessed, either a conservation project was funded or if biodiversity was maintained in the forest, then conservation in the forest was successful.
Rule13: If development activity was banned, then a development proposal was not rejected.
Rule14: Industry encroached upon the forest, or a forest area was preserved, or conservation in the forest was successful.
Rule15: A threat to the ecosystem was detected, or a threat to the ecosystem was identified.
Rule16: Provided that a threat to the ecosystem was identified, industry did not encroach upon the forest.

Rule17: Researchers collaborated with the community, or if it is not the case that if a threat to the ecosystem was detected then industry did not encroach upon the forest, then a threat to the ecosystem was mitigated.
Rule18: Conservation efforts were coordinated, or researchers did not collaborate with the community.
Rule19: Whenever human-wildlife conflict was avoided, the migration of deer was not disrupted.
Rule20: Human-wildlife conflict occurred, or human-wildlife conflict was avoided.
Rule21: Under the condition that prevention measures were implemented, human-wildlife conflict did not occur.
Rule22: If management actions were recommended, then if prevention measures were not implemented, the community suffered losses.
Rule23: Management actions were recommended, or management actions were adopted.
Rule24: If management actions were adopted, then management actions were executed.
Rule25: Whenever a study on deer was published, a decline in the deer population was documented.
Rule26: Management actions were neglected, or if management actions were executed, then if prevention measures were not implemented, the community suffered losses.
Rule27: If the forest habitat was protected, then conservation in the forest was successful.
Rule28: Provided that a forest reserve was proposed, development did not disturb the forest.
Rule29: If the forest reserve was approved, then development did not disturb the forest.
Rule30: Provided that it is not the case that either deer were monitored during the spring or wolves were not observed in the forest, a study on deer was published.

Rule31: If it is not the case that if the impact of protection was evaluated then either a conservation project was funded or if biodiversity was maintained in the forest then conservation in the forest was successful, then a development proposal was rejected.

Rule32: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the impact of protection was evaluated then either a conservation project was funded or if biodiversity was maintained in the forest then conservation in the forest was successful, development activity was banned.
Rule33: Provided that it is not the case that if a threat to the ecosystem was detected then industry did not encroach upon the forest, a threat to the ecosystem was not mitigated.
Rule34: If it is not the case that either a forest reserve was proposed or the forest reserve was approved, then the migration of deer was disrupted.
Rule35: If the forest habitat was not protected, then development disturbed the forest.
Rule36: If conservation in the forest was not successful, then the forest ecosystem was damaged.
facts: Fact1: Monitoring of wolves was continued.
Fact2: Biodiversity was maintained in the forest.
Fact3: It is not the case that the movement of wolves was tracked.
Fact4: It is not the case that deer were monitored during the spring.
Fact5: It is not the case that a conservation project was funded.
Fact6: It is not the case that a forest area was preserved.
Fact7: It is not the case that a decline in the deer population was documented.
Fact8: It is not the case that conservation efforts were coordinated.
Fact9: It is not the case that the community suffered losses.
Fact10: It is not the case that management actions were neglected.

question: Conservation in the forest was successful.
